sentences.en: And he has often fallen foul of the Argentinian oligarchy.
sentences.cn: 同时他还时常与阿根廷的寡头统治相抵触.

sentences.en: Athens was suffering under the rule of an oligarchy that had no concern for the people's welfare.
sentences.cn: 雅典当时饱受寡头集团的统治，他们对人民的福祉毫不关心。

sentences.en: But plenty of thoughtful people ( many of them in the Lords ) are holding out for oligarchy.
sentences.cn: 不过,众多考虑周全之士 ( 许多来自上院 ) 还是强烈要求维持现状.

sentences.en: Eventually oligarchy took over from democracy.
sentences.cn: 最终寡头政治取代了民主制度。

sentences.en: How far did the Meiji constitution confirm the powers of the Meiji oligarchy?
sentences.cn: 明治宪法使明治王朝的权力巩毋固到甚麽程度?

sentences.en: Insecure and fearful of its own people, the oligarchy preserves itself through tyranny.
sentences.cn: 由于担心和害怕自己的人民, 统治集团只能靠实行暴政来维护其统治.

sentences.en: The big cities were notoriously in the hands of the oligarchy of local businessmen.
sentences.cn: 众所周知,大城市已经掌握在当地商人的寡头统治中.

sentences.en: The financial oligarchy is the real ruler of capitalist monopolies.
sentences.cn: 金融寡头是垄断资本主义的真正统治者.

words.tran_cn: 寡头政治的；主张寡头政治的

trans.tran_cn: 寡头统治的政府，寡头政治的执政集团，寡头统治的国家
trans.tran_en: a small group of people who run a country or organization, or a country that is run by a small group of people
